understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that retrieves the column index cache size in kilobytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration as it accesses the column_index_cache_size_in_kb value from the configuration object to determine the column index cache size.

config_description: Per sstable indexed key cache entries (the collation index in memory mentioned above) exceeding this size will not be held on heap. This means that only partition information is held on heap and the index entries are read from disk.  Note that this size refers to the size of the serialized index information and not the size of the partition.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code retrieves the column index cache size in kilobytes from the DatabaseDescriptor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the getColumnIndexCacheSize() method is called in the code.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'column_index_cache_size_in_kb' configuration option is that it determines the size limit for sstable indexed key cache entries. Entries exceeding this size will not be held on heap, meaning only partition information is held on heap and index entries are read from disk. This can affect memory usage and performance of the system.
